job.title: Production Supervisor
job.description:
External Job Title Production Supervisor
Function Operations Type of Job Full Time - Exempt Country Canada External Job Description Purpose Supervise and coordinate all activities of production workers, including operational, personnel, and administrative tasks. Develop, manage, and lead a performance oriented team based staff.
Decision Making Daily staffing of operations. Assignment of personnel to production areas. Prioritizing tasks to be completed with available staff. Risk: Production needs not fulfilled. Available staff not effectively utilized. Additional costs to the company. Daily responsibility for line operations. This includes involvement in quality issues, machine capability, and adherence to work rules. Risk: Safety requirements not met. Production needs not fulfilled. Machinery may not operate efficiently, increasing costs to the company. If work rules are not adhered to, there is increase opportunity for workplace injury to employees.
Financial Responsibility Managing production lines to optimize efficiencies and reduce labor costs. Maximizing through puts while minimizing labor use. Manage supply accounts by achieving the best cost with vendors. Develop new process and programs to reduce and minimize losses (product, packaging materials).
Management Responsibility Directly responsible for hourly workers and indirectly oversee maintenance staff.
Complexity of Role Manages full shift responsibility. Ensure Safety Requirements are met at all times. Up to 120 hourly workers and 20 temporary agency employees and lead personnel as applicable Develop hourly employees to perform in a self directed environment Resolving employee issues (including Grievances in unionized facilities) Manage corporate programs, food safety, employee safety, GMPs and environmental. Responsible for Time & Attendance of employees for payroll purposes
Key Outputs/Deliverables Supervisory responsibilities are in accordance with company policy and applicable laws. Responsibilities include: training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding, disciplining, and motivating employees; addressing complaints, resolving conflict, solving problems, scheduling vacations, and verifying payroll sheets. Ensure efficient production is achieved and standards are met. Optimize safety, quality, production, and cost objectives through employee involvement and team building approach to problem solving. Train and monitor personnel to ensure proper procedures are followed. Communicate production schedules and schedule changes to appropriate departments. Direct the planning and implementation of key initiatives to improve bottling operations. Ensure all monthly safety and food safety audits are completed on time, all corrective action items are completed, and all bottling workers understand the goals. Review all production paperwork and ensure all paperwork is filled out accurately and completely. Ensure production databases are properly maintained and information utilized for continuous improvement. Monitor parts and supplies inventories and place all necessary orders to ensure business needs are met. Manage assigned budget accounts. Complete labor cost estimates for special projects and rework. Generate ideas and implement changes in processes and use of equipment to increase efficiency, improve safety and quality, reduce costs, and improve employee morale. Research, write, and implement assigned Capital Authorizations (CAs).
Experience BA/BS in Business, Management, or Engineering, five plus years of supervisory experience in high speed bottling plant; or equivalent combination of education and experience. In Distilling Operations: BS in Science or Engineering, preferably chemical engineering In Unionized facilities: Union experience an asset Thorough working knowledge and demonstrated expertise in all areas of high speed bottling activities, including machine operations, machine changeovers, start-up, shut-down, package quality, Applicable H&S laws & standards, and BATF and/or Excise compliance.

Function GDBS Type of Job Permanent Country Hungary External Job Description Context
GDBS has been established in Budapest for 11 years.It provides back office transactional services relating to the Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, and Record to Report processes (including relationships with UK tax authorities) with all associated data activities.It also encompasses a significant part of the group’s Financial Planning and Reporting activities (Europe, International, Supply and Corporate),Treasury activities (Accounting, Control and Performance), Finance Systems, Governance and Compliance and Project Management activities.

-SAP frontend for Windows

Automate GDBS processes; minimize manual interventions in the BAU environment. Main assets are Smart-forms, Excel macro, SAP scripting, VB Scripting,
SAP GUI Scripting, VB Scripting is an automation interface that enhances the capabilities of SAP GUI for Windows and JVM. Using this interface, end users may automate repetitive tasks by recording and running macro-like scripts. Administrators and developers on the other hand may build tools for server-side application testing or client-side application integration

Client Relationships/Focus

Qualifications and experience required
Essential:
•Experience in application development Access 2000 or above.
•Experience in creating VBS or VBA codes for the following: Access, Word and/or Excel.
•5 month to 1 year experience working with Microsoft platform
Desirable:

job.title: Statutory Compliance Controller - FTC
job.description:
External Job Title Statutory Compliance Controller - FTC
Function GDBS Type of Job Fixed Term Contractor (FTC) Country Hungary External Job Description Fixed Term Contract: 01/04/2020 - 31/08/2014 Context
GDBS is a multicultural, multi-language environment. The Statutory Compliance area is focusing on improving compliance with regulatory requirements with the implementation of Statutory Compliance agenda, which is part of the implementation of the Test Company new Finance operating Model. Heart of this is the G&C Model” where GDBS takes responsibility an ownership for statutory compliance (statutory accounting, direct and indirect tax management and company secretariat) whilst the markets Finance Director retains accountability for these affairs.
The Statutory Reporting and Corporate Tax Team is one of the teams in Statutory Compliance and looks after Statutory Governance (Financial Statement preparation) and corporate tax management activities.
This team manages the contract Test Company signed with the Global Tax Outsourcer (GOP”) for corporate tax compliance and reporting in some territories. This included service, performance, contract management and corporate tax realted governance. The Team is also involved in the tax reporting process for group consolidation. Within that the team supports Group Tax in collection cash tax information and information on tax risks for the Rest of the World (ROW”) area, territories outside GBP, IOI, USA and the Netherlands.
The Statutory Compliance area is focusing on improving compliance with regulatory requirements. There is an increasing scrutiny from regulatory bodies with regard to statutory accounts and increased focus and more invasive questioning into the governance, underlying records and activities of statutory entities. On the other hand Test Company runs its business with a complex legal entity structure coupled with complex mapping of management entities into statutory accounts. This creates a challenge for making sure that whilst focusing on business performance statutory compliance requirements are also met. Dimensions of the role
Market Complexity The main markets are Western Europe: Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Belgium, Denmark, Norway, Sweden; Netherland and Ireland Top accountabilities
* To produce statutory entity accounts under relevant local GAAP for each financial year in line with timetable. Also produce analytical review of statutory accounts to provide meaningful explanation of the entity’s activities and performance during the financial year
* To ensure that the year end financial statements are audit compliant and to ensure that the served markets fully meet external and Test Company internal statutory reporting requirements and deadlines.
* To manage corporate tax affairs (compliance, reporting, risk & opportunity management, transfer pricing) of related markets with the assistance of the Global Tax Outsourcer and Group Tax
* To carry out quarterly cash tax forecasting for selected top cash tax payer Rest of the World territories and to create summary papers for tax reporting Qualifications and experience required
Must have:
* Qualified Accountant with a minimum 2-3 year post qualification experience
* Strong communication and influencing skills (written & verbal)
* Experience of working within international / multicultural environment
* Experience in IFRS and other local GAAPs
* Understanding of taxation, primarily corporate tax
* Experience in working with integrated software system (SAP knowledge is an advantage)
* Attention to detail / Overview of the business: able to operate at the detailed level when necessary, but always focuses on the big picture
* Results orientated and capable of working in a deadline driven environment
* Fluent in English
* Self-starter – ability to work through problems to resolution
* Strong analytical and questioning skills Advantage:
* Audit background is an advantage
* International qualification (IAS, ACCA) is an advantage

Test Company is the world's leading premium drinks business with an outstanding collection of beverage alcohol brands across spirits, wine and beer categories - including Smirnoff, Guinness and Johnnie Walker (to name but a few). Trading in approximately 180 markets, we employ over 23,000 talented people around the world with one aim: to help millions of people celebrate life every day, everywhere. St James’s Gate Brewery is a key site within the Europe Beer division of Global Beer Supply, Test Company plc. The St James’s Gate vision is to be the supplier of choice within Test Company Global Supply and to be one of the most admired breweries in the world.

Our primary focus is to produce quality wines by selecting top vineyards and fruit from various sub-appellations. Must be computer literate, with proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel. 7. Must have a good driving record, dependable transportation, and be of legal drinking age. 8. job.description:
External Job Title Global Audit and Risk Manager
Function Finance Type of Job Full Time - Non-Exempt (OT eligible) Country United Kingdom External Job Description Context
Global Audit & Risk (GAR) sits within the Global Finance function. GAR’s goal is to support and challenge the business to ensure that Test Company is recognised as a company that delivers holistic business performance. Holistic business performance means that controls, governance and compliance are part of the fabric of the company, and the business as a whole embraces the controls and compliance culture as an integral part of the delivery of success.
Dimensions of the role Key activities that are undertaken by GAR are:
Delivering high quality and risk based internal audit (‘assurance’) reviews of business processes, business change, and the management of financial, operational and compliance risks. Supporting and challenging the business to effectively identify, manage and report on business risk, including ensuring that committees and governance structures are functioning effectively. Developing and maintaining an effective Global Compliance Programme that ensures that the group’s policies are embedded in the business, that good practice is shared, and that any compliance breaches are investigated and resolved promptly. Developing and rolling-out an effective business continuity planning programme.
Significant travel (up to 70%) will be required to fulfil the role requirements. Location of the role is flexible.
Purpose of Role The primary focus of this role is to provide assurance on the effectiveness of risk management and control procedures across the business and to highlight any particular risk areas.
Top 3-5 accountabilities Delivery of holistic risk management and internal audit assurance reviews in line with GAR’s Ways of Working to provide assurance on the effectiveness of risk management and control procedures. Provide insight and solutions that promote effective business governance, enhanced controls and better risk management. Support the embedding of governance, risk and compliance across the business by providing regular guidance to functional and business unit management GAR relationship responsibility for key elements of the business (to be determined by the Director, Global Audit & Risk on a role by role basis). This responsibility includes acting as the GAR contact for business unit and/or hub management, alongside the direct or indirect leadership of all GAR assignments and engagement within the relevant area of the business. Develop, commit to and action a self-development programme, and contribute to the development of others in the team.
Qualifications and experience required Minimum 5 years’ experience, including in a multinational (ideally multicultural/multilingual) corporate environment, with exposure to some of the following areas: Internal / external audit with detailed understanding of potential risks and controls Familiarity with external assurance methodologies Risk management Business process understanding Compliance experience Process improvement Project management Business consulting
Qualified Accountant and/or MBA, or professional qualification or equivalent experience in one of the above.
Relationship management and business partnering skills – proven experience of building, developing and sustaining relationships with key stakeholders, especially senior management. The ability to influence strategic decisions across the business.
Project management skills with experience of managing and delivering different priorities.
People management skills – ability to influence, cajole and direct where appropriate. Know when to make a difference; judge when to intervene.

Context
The Contracts & Documents team within firstpoint is an integral part of the operations and is responsible for executing Employee Lifecycle Transactions (ELC) in a consistent, compliant and efficient way. They are inextricably linked with the other teams in firstpoint, Resourcing, ELC and Contact Centre, and are typically the last part of the chain to resolve and process employee and business requests. Within the C&D team, there are also a group of In Market Coordinators (IMCs) who have additional responsibilities related to the local market in which they sit. The team also executes various related administration aspects including absence recording, management of post, scanning, filing, printing and distribution of correspondence. These vary from location to location, but can include providing support for Payroll processes, resourcing, L&D and local reward processes.
Market Complexity
The HR coordinator will partner with FirstPoint in London and the local HR team in Madrid. The In Market HR Coordinator is responsible for providing HR transactional services and activities where face to face or local support in market is required. Is operating as part of FirstPoint to ensure consistency and efficiency of delivery within market, while providing necessary on the ground support.
The HR coordinator works across the whole HR team, and the entire Spanish market, and will need to have a close cooperation with the person responsible for Payroll locally, and the First Point HR advisors in London.
Purpose of Role
The HR Coordinator is the critical link between FirstPoint in London and the local HR Team in Madrid. Together with FirstPoint you will provide superior service in terms of fulfilling transactional activities, optimising information resolutions and providing great service. Being the ‘ears and eyes’ on the ground you play a key role in the impementation, further development and improvement of the different ways of working in this new model.

• Is the role model for utilisation of the HR Model and pushes” HR queries to the appropriate channels • Gathers data and feedback for review of activities and services being provided using SLA (Service Level Agreement) data where available, in line with firstpoint practice • Prints and distributes letters and correspondence developed in firstpoint where appropriate for the market • Manages appropriate EIC queries (case management system) and related FirstPoint activities to closure • Ensure compliance within the processes s/he run Resourcing • Receives employment contract electronically from firstpoint team – prints, signs and sends. Collates hard copy pack of necessary materials to send with the contract • Receives signed contract back, scans and stores to doc point ensuring firstpoint advisor takes any required action for the docs. • Ensures all hard copy documents are collected in market from new starters to action, scan and store Absence Management • Manage Absence processes/Assist in absence processes in line with local requirements (ensures hard copy docs are scanned and archived and picked up by 3rd party provider) Reward and Benefits • Support reward service delivery of First Point reward team in terms of document management as required. • Support Flexible Benefit enrolment administration (file and archive signed documents Other In-market activity (specific to market)
Qualifications and experience required
• Fluent Spanish and English • Able to plan, prioritize, and coordinate daily tasks under limited/remote supervision • Strong communication and interpersonal skills • Able to build relationship and maintain credibility with stake holders • Excellent computer skills (MS Office)

job.title: Sales Executive
job.description:
External Job Title Sales Executive
Function Sales - Commercial Type of Job Full Time - Exempt Country United Kingdom External Job Description
Here at Test Company we are looking for our next generation of Commercial Field Executives. We are looking for a range of Executives in various locations around the UK.
What are we looking for?
We need dynamic and driven individuals who love being given a challenging plan. And then delivering it. We need individuals who love working as part of a cross-functional team, working with a broad group of people to deliver fantastic outcomes. We need individuals who feel at home challenging the norm in the quest for better outcomes. If you like to think creatively, work in a commercial, but incredibly supportive environment, support others in developing fantastic careers whilst building one of your own then you are in the right place. We are looking for people who have a good base of commercial skills and a proven track record of delivering great commercial outcomes. In return, we can offer the opportunity to develop a brilliant career in one of the best companies in the world, with an exciting future in anything from Customer Planning & Activation, Category Development, Shopper Marketing to Account Management and beyond.
A day in the life of this role looks like:
You wake up buzzing about what today brings. The biggest week for Pimms this year, this sun is shining and you are kitted out in your Pimms T-Shirt. You have your Perfect Serve kit ready to go and a car safely packed with visibility items. You log onto you IPad and see you have a message from your CSM Morning, today is the day we paint Liverpool and Manchester Red. Sixty outlets in about the next seven hours, here’s the picture of what Great Looks like, let’s go and make it happen! The first team to hit 500 cases of transfer hours today wins a team night out, let’s make that the Granada team - I’ve already booked the table.”
You call your team mate before heading out to double check the volume deal for today, then it’s off to your first call. You build a Pimms garden, convince the sign writer to mark up all the chalkboards with the pitcher price offer, dress the staff and demonstrate the perfect serve. You then sell in the staff incentive to promote the Pitcher deal when customers are ordering a round of drinks. Finally you take a transactional order for an additional 10 cases of Pimms. You agree with the bar owner that you will call him on Monday to get the sales results for the weekend. Having completed your admin on your iPad in the call, you are straight onto your next call.
There’s no stopping you, a whole section of the bar is devoted to Pimms, fresh fruit from the kitchen in a jug creates a tempting display and a banner along the car park ensures consumers can’t miss us as they walk in.
You get an instant message on your iPad to say your region is currently in second place for todays incentive. You call your friend and set yourselves a goal of 10 cases each in the next call.
After your successful calls you meet up with your team mates at a venue where the Pimms Brigade are arriving. You talk to consumers about the pitcher offer and hand out a voucher for £1 off their next pitcher on their next visit. What a day!
3 top Functional Capabilities
Brilliant Persuasive Selling Skills – Needs to be able to achieve high strike rate, it only takes one call
Territory Management – Highly organised in order to deliver call rate required for this role
Brilliant Execution – Understands what it takes to brilliantly execute and has the attention to detail to deliver consistently at scale
Qualifications and experience required
1-2 years of sales experience or a graduate with a proven record of consistently delivering great performance
Experience of how to capitalise on experiential activity to drive base rate of sale and build products in consumers’ drinking repertoires
In-depth knowledge of the features and benefits of our brands
Experience of what it takes to impact consumer behaviour at the point of purchase

CELEBRATING LIFE - EVERYDAY, EVERYWHERE.
Test Company is the world's leading premium drinks business with an outstanding collection of international brands across spirits, wine and beer. Our global priority brand portfolio consists of Smirnoff, Johnnie Walker, Guinness, Baileys, J&B, Captain Morgan, José Cuervo, Tanqueray and many more.

Our great range of brands and geographic spread means that people can celebrate with our products at every occasion no matter where they are in the world. This is why 'celebrating life every day, everywhere' is at the core of what we do.

As a member of the UK and Ireland Occupational Health team, you will be based at Shieldhall, Glasgow, and also cover the nearby Dundas House, Blythswood and Linwood sites. You will work as part of a team and support the Occupational Health Nursing Advisor to maximise and promote optimum health for all employees and is crucial to the success of the business. The successful candidate will aim to prevent work-related ill-health and maintain employees’ productivity at work, in a highly competitive market.
Responsibilities include:
·Ensure smooth running of health surveillance programmes for staff.
·Carry out health assessments, e.g. employment /re-deployment, pregnant worker assessments and driver assessments
·Initiating, maintaining and updating of individual occupational health records, ensuring confidential, effective and safe operation of manual and electronic systems
·Working closely with Occupational Health Nursing Advisor to identify opportunities for health promotion/education/training on health issues.
·Ensuring all departmental equipment is maintained and safe for use, in line with purchasing guidelines and Test Company standards.

If you are a Registered Nurse with a strong interest in Occupational Health and would like to further your career with one of the world’s fastest growing organisations, then apply now stating your salary expectations.
We are looking for:
·A Registered nurse with post registration experience
·Previous screening Nurse experience is a preferred but not essential as full training will be given
·Has an interest in Occupational Health
·PC literate with knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
·Full Driving License and own car as you will be driving between sites

job.description:
External Job Title Design Lead Director

We are seeking an inspired Design Leader with great creative judgement and even better ability to form relationships & influence at all levels of the organisation.You will not be a glorified Project Manager, rather lead the thinking, partnering with great Innovators,Marketeersand external Designers, bringing about excellence through your vision, relationships & influence.

job.title: Data Analyst
job.description:
External Job Title Data Analyst
Function Corporate relations Type of Job Full Time - Exempt Country United Kingdom External Job Description Context
Our markets around the world face the threat of excise increases or other detrimental tax changes. Understanding the impact of such changes on our profitability and government revenue is paramount in developing our strategy and informing our dialogue with the government.
The Data Analyst, reports into the Global Head of Tax Public Affairs, and supports our global tax agenda and to provide econometric, economic and financial analysis of excise policies
Purpose of Role The primary objective of the role is to model the impact of regulatory changes on Test Company and governments’ revenue using a proprietary Test Company tool
The incumbent will customise the model for each market, collect required data inputs from publicly available and internal Test Company sources, calibrate the model and run scenarios proposed by the team to fully understand how a tax change might impact revenue for the Government and Test Company.
He/she will then summarise the output of scenario planning graphically and provide an interpretation of results.
In addition, he/she will undertake other analysis to provide markets with strong data-based arguments in their dialogue with governments as well as inform the company’s public affairs strategy in the tax area. Top 3-5 accountabilities
* Obtain data required to for modelling – both Test Company internal data, via liaising with in-country CR and Finance teams, and publicly available information using tools such as AC Nielsen, IWSR etc
* Effectively manage these large amounts of data, presented in various formats, and convert into the inputs required for modelling
* Populate the data model with information, calibrate (including setting up value chains for each category of alcohol to the point where tax might differ) and run scenarios proposed by the team
* Present the output of scenario planning in a presentation/graphic form with interpretation to enable the team to decide on further stratagey
* Verify model output against actual numbers
* Analyse trends and tax burdens in different markets. Qualifications and experience required
* PhD or Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics or Business
* Finance qualification (CPA, ACCA) , or 3+ years experience in Finance or Consumer Planning a plus
* Ability to manage projects, prioritise and work to deadlines
* Experience of working in a FMCG or equivalent environment, or consultancy
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills
* Ability to work and engage cross-functionally and remotely – excellent communication skills both written and verbal and great interpersonal skills both over the phone and face to face
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Understanding of or interest in public policy is a plus
* Knowledge of other languages is a plus

Jeremiah Weed Brews are now on all the top poster sites within your territory and you want to make sure all of your top accounts are giving the brand feature and display behind the back bar. To do this, you have meetings planned over 2 days with your top 14 customers, and you are determined to win a fabulous incentive for the top performer. To help, you have also lined up a meeting with a contact from Matthew Clarke, and from Booker, as they both have the brand on promotion. Your second big focus area is to win pouring status and beat the competition in a small market town where the owner has a nightclub, a bar and also runs the bar at two golf clubs. Winning this customer is worth over £20k of NSV, but it is competitive and you feel really well prepared via your customer and brand insight. Your third priority is Pimms. Historically, the brand has under- performed in your territory but it is in all the local supermarkets and you know that there is strong consumer demand. You have identified twenty accounts in your territory, and during your pre-arranged call you want to get the managers to agree to run a promotion for the bank holiday. You have spent lots of time with customers and at close of play on Friday you are able to phone your line manager and tell them you now have 20 outlets signed up for Pimms, you have won your biggest pouring opportunity and that you have just passed on transfer orders for Jeremiah and Pimms to the RTM team.

Activation and innovation programmes are Delivered Brilliantly, with 100% compliance on, and your key outlets are shrines for our brands across key retail outlets within your territory
Strong productive relationships with key stakeholders in your territory, in particular external RTM contacts, transform customer results
Experience Required
This role would be ideal for an On or Off Trade sales / customer facing person with 12 months commercial experience and a record of delivering targets
Strong influencing and relationship building skills
An understanding of the levers which we can use to drive consumer demand for our products, and how we can use our portfolio to drive mutual value

job.description:
External Job Title Strategy Manager
Function Finance Type of Job Full Time - Exempt Country United Kingdom External Job Description Context
In the new operating model, strategy resources that work at the market level are within market teams - Corporate Strategy is the new group created to work on strategic issues / opportunities that are corporate / global / above market. Corporate Strategy provides a specialist capability to resolve the questions that will shape the medium-term performance and direction of the business – often complex questions that require new thinking outside the normal run of business. As a small team of six, Corporate Strategy focuses against the ‘highest value at stake’ issues and opportunities facing Test Company to deliver tangible value and impact.
Corporate Strategy is part of the Finance Function, though is represented directly on the Test Company Exec by Group Strategy Director. The group works largely with members of the Test Company Exec on projects to help them resolve high value at stake issues, find opportunities and create possibilities for Test Company.
Project ways of working are diverse – this role sometimes works with resource from other parts of the business, sometimes with other corporate strategy team members or external consultants and sometimes alone (although always with support of other members of the global strategy community). Projects typically last 3 months and are away from London up to 50% of the time. Purpose of Role
To help Test Company Executive resolve high value at stake issues and opportunities. The role may address a wide variety of issues e.g. Consumer/Brand strategies, market attractiveness, route to market options and a range of others. As part of the strategy community”, this role also helps develop the capabilities of market strategists across Test Company.

Understand sponsor’s issue to identify scope of work and plan the activities and resources required for the project. 2.1 from leading university (MBA useful but not essential). 2-3 years experience in top-tier strategy consultancy. Commercial experience outside consulting ideal. Good experience of analytical commercial problem solving. Good experience in communicating conclusions (written and verbal). Good experience at relationship building. Language skills an advantage.

job.description:
External Job Title Sales Director-UBL
Function Sales Type of Job Full Time - Exempt Country Uganda External Job Description Job Title:Sales Director
Context/Scope: EABL operates within a multi cultural, multi national, multi currency environment. EABL comprises four business units: KBL, EAML, SBL,CGI and UBL. UBL is further categorised into Demand and Supply. The Supply business is involved in production of beer and spirits. The Demand business is involved in marketing and pushing the product to consumers. This role is located within the Demand Sales business. The Sales Director is a member of the UBL board of Directors based in Kampala and is responsible for delivering 100% of UBL’s volume, with key influence on volume/profit, directs sales operation of c.130 people, is office & field based and has key contact with Distributors owners/senior/middle management.
The Sales Director works 60% office 40% field across all regions, long travelling time and frequently away from home overnight. The job holder works within parameters agreed by UBL board and Managing Director-UBL, agrees working parameters with FSM, regional & operations management, is the internal liaison with all EABL/UBL departmental heads and has a high level of cross functional support.
The job holder works closely with CEO’s and senior management of distributors, retail chains, retailers and other major companies.
Market Complexity: UBL is one of the dominant players in the Uganda drinks market.
Leadership Responsibilities:
The Sales Director heads the sales team and is responsible for setting and executing the overall sales strategy to ensure achievement of key performance indicators.
Purpose of Role:
To define and gain Board agreement for the Company sales strategy that achieves effective implementation of the UBL marketing plan. To direct, control, motivate, lead and train the UBL sales operation to achieve agreed sales, distribution, market share and performance objectives through the effective management of both Distributor and Retail sales operations.
To create and manage an organisation through which plans and programmes are implemented to the highest standards (Be The Best). To specify the methods, technology and resources by which the UBL sales strategy is to be achieved.
TOP 3-5 Accountabilities; • Achieve profit, volume, KPI objectives, contribute towards the planning, implementation, review and replanning of the KBL strategic plan. • Define clear objectives, tactics and plans to manage the achievement of our sales strategy and the effective execution of the UBL marketing plan. • Ensure that sales training and personal development programmes are up to date and reflect the needs of individuals. • Ensure appropriate action taken for Individuals who show potential, people who are in roles for which they are not suited and poor performers as well as complete PMS for each direct report and ensure completion for full sales team. • To take proactive action to minimize the potential for fraud within the sales division. • Manage the UBL sales operation through a team of on trade, off trade, operations and commercial management to manage the Distributor strategy to plan and ensure a Distributor audit strategy is implemented by Regional and Distributor management. • Ensure compliance with safety requirements at the work environment.
Qualifications and Experience Required:
Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in Business Administration or related field Masters degree in Business Administration
Experience • Experienced all round manager with at least seven (7) years senior man-management experience.
• Successful track record with a sound knowledge of both sales and marketing with an excellent understanding of NPD, Distribution, Sales forecasting, Pricing, Advertising and sales promotion, Public relations and Marketing planning and control.

Purpose of Role:
The role will carry out analytical and sensory analysis on product samples as part of product and supplier development. He/she will work closely with the distillation, liquid and packaging engineers and technologists to ensure that results are produced in an efficient and timely manner for our customers. Responsible for reporting and cataloguing results to ensure easy access for future reference
Context/Scope:
LAC regional has doubled in size in the last 5 years and this trend is set to continue. Following the changes to the global operating model to support and accelerate our growth ambition, the LAC region now consists of four strategic business units, Mexico, West LAC (including markets such Chile, Argentina, Central America and Caribbean), Andean ( Venezuela and Colombia) and PUB (Paraguay, Uruguay and Brazil).
The Panama Technical Hub is being set up to provide technical leadership for Test Company’s growing LAC business across the region whilst leveraging the full Global Technical organization, partnering the Global Brand Teams and each markets local Brand Change teams.
The Regional Brand Change and Technical team is responsible for building and supporting the commercialization of new products, carrying out all due diligence in local sourcing and BVE projects in the LAC Supply organization and is also responsible for the protection of Brand Technical Equity via product integrity, regulatory, standard setting and other programs.
The role is a key part of the Panama technical team within the LAC Technical function.
The focus of this role is three fold: (i) To carry out and interpret a range of analysis on both raw materials and final products (existing and new products) (ii) To manage and maintain a LAC Sensory panel which will carry out sensory on currents brands and innovations (iii) To assist regional and market BC and quality teams in qualifying new suppliers, creating new specifications, troubleshooting and auditing existing suppliers and co packers
Leadership Required:
· Consistently demonstrates effective team working skills and has a commitment to providing exemplary service. Needs to be a self-starter continuously building knowledge and skills to execute and interpret analytical results.
· Uses well developed interpersonal skills to build strong and lasting relationships to positively influences internal & external stakeholders
· Looks to take on new challenges grow scope of role; refine processes to deliver more value for business.
· Demonstrates absolute thoroughness in all aspects of sample analysis and reporting results and show s initiative.
Top 3-5 Accountabilities:
· Manage analytical and sensory areas including processing of samples and reporting of results
· Ensure that all the equipment is maintained and where required service contracts are in place and maintained
· Report on consumable use on a monthly basis
· Maintain sensory panel with regular refresher and induction training when required
· Work to support team in interpreting sensory scores and report to key stakeholders
Qualifications and Experience Required:
· Minimum 2 years working in a lab in an analytical role
· Chemistry degree and experience of specific technical equipment such as GC, Distillation
· Experience in building and managing sensory panels would be an advantage
· Experience of LIMS systems and reporting results to a wide community at regular periods
· Strong communication skills (verbal, written)
· Proactive and able to multitask
· Commercial acumen and ability to comprehend impact of laboratory environment on business performance.

Finally to close off a great week, you speak to two of the regional directors from MCW and Booker. You discuss opportunities for a staff incentive and depot displays ahead of the next Bank Holiday and agree a target of an incremental 1000 cases of spirits from this activity. This all contributes to your regional plan and you ask one of your team to create a brief for this activity

job.title: Business Development Executive
job.description:
External Job Title Business Development Executive
Function Sales - Field Sales Type of Job Full Time - Exempt Country United Kingdom External Job Description Here at Test Company we arelooking for our next generation of Commercial Field Executives. We are looking for a range of Executives in various locations around the UK.
What are we looking for?
We need dynamic and driven individuals who love being given a challenging plan. And then delivering it. We need individuals who love working as part of a cross-functional team, working with a broad group of people to deliver fantastic outcomes. We need individuals who feel at home challenging the norm in the quest for better outcomes. If you like to think creatively, work in a commercial, but incredibly supportive environment, support others in developing fantastic careers whilst building one of your own then you are in the right place. We are looking for people who have a good base of commercial skills and a proven track record of delivering great commercial outcomes. In return, we can offer the opportunity to develop a brilliant career in one of the best companies in the world, with an exciting future in anything from Customer Planning & Activation, Category Development, Shopper Marketing to Account Management and beyond.
A week in the life looks like:
This week you have three key priorities -
Changeover day in a major fascia, core brand availability for Easter weekend & the launch of a new Baileys bottle.
You own your retail sales value target. To ensure the biggest RSV return this week on your territory you ensure that you are well planned for the week ahead to deliver against your key priorities.
Planning ensures you have set 27 calls for this week with clear and ambitious objectives set for each call. 14 of the calls have confirmed GSM appointments, with one regional trade driver meeting. With a major account change over on Wednesday you have planned all appointments and calls on this day in this fascia in the biggest opportunity accounts.
You have analysed your data and from this you have built great, data driven, customer selling propositions for all GSM meetings. You have liaised with the regional BDM on your customer proposal for your trade driver meeting to deliver the best return from this meeting.
To ensure the highest level of customer interaction, and ownership for delivery of your retail sales value target, all calls this week are focused on delivering the greatest opportunity: availability of core brands ahead of a key trading period. Excellent execution and incremental visibility for the new Baileys bottle launch will drive your incremental retails sales value target.
Throughout the week you liaise with all the fascia champs and other members of the team to ensure clear understanding of each fascia. You are clear on the return delivered from your calls and what areas add the most value in each call.
Historically Baileys has under-performed at Easter but the new bottle can drive incremental RSV and interest in the brand, especially at this time of year with Easter and Mother’s Day. To drive this and make a real impact on your territory you have arranged a meeting with a key fascia trade driver and through liaising with the regional BDE you are fully prepared to meet the customer needs and the brand requirements through a fantastic proposal across your region to increase visibility and day one execution through a regional incentive. You have identified twenty accounts in your territory with an opportunity to drive incremental £30k RSV.
Your calls are focused on strong, followed up with great execution of planned activities in each store. You deliver value for customers and Test Company in every call and can clearly calculate the additional value your calls have delivered.
At close of play on Friday you phone your manager, and tell them you have achieved an incremental £48k RSV. This is a great result and drive from excellent planning, clear priorities and objectives for each call, use of data driven selling arguments to support objectives and the level of customer interaction and ownership of tangible retail sales value.

job.title: Captain Morgan Chief Officer of the Watch (Global Brand Director)
job.description:
External Job Title Captain Morgan Chief Officer of the Watch (Global Brand Director)
Function Marketing Type of Job Full Time - Exempt Country United Kingdom External Job Description THERE’S ONLY ONE CAPTAIN.
AND YOU GOTTA EARN THE RIGHT TO STAND BY HIS SIDE.
You may know the character on that bottle ofCaptain Morgan Rumby name. But to really know the legendary man behind the brand is to know our reason for being. Henry Morgan was the Governor of Jamaica back in 1682. It was his love of life and sense of unscripted adventure that attracted the most hell-bent loyal crewmembers, and which created his biggest legacy of all.
He was the first rock star. A man who rewrote the rules of success and knew how to lead — and win. And now, we are in search of an equally adventurous leader andGlobal Brand Directorwho has the same vision and leadership that begets the legend of the man himself. This person would be in charge of the Global Brand Team’s responsibilities toprovide strategic and creative direction for a double-digit growth brand that now ships 10M cases globally and help stay on course to become the #1 Spirits brand in the Rum category. And as any Captain knows, there’s more success where that comes from. The person who stands on the helm of this global brandhas the ambition to drive Captain Morgan to £1 billion Net Sales Value by 2020 by expanding territories and growth opportunities inWestern Europe and Russia/Eastern Europe, as well as expanding our Asian Pacific presence and creating a broad and robust African business.
Does that sound like a task you could heave onto your shoulders and charge forward to make the likes of Henry Morgan proud? Good. Intestinal fortitude will carry you so far, but proven marketing judgment andstrategic penetration at the highest level of business will be your key to new opportunities. Because every Captain has a north star to success. You must be able to lead a global team and ensure markets implement their annual plans brilliantly. Because that’s what Captains do: They lead. You will need to influence a range of very senior stakeholders, as well as simplify issues and be on the front lines of global brand growth, helpingbuild an effective partnership with the critical US market (70% of global sales) and senior relationships with key In Market Companies (atGeneral Manager & Marketing Director levels). Most of all, you will motivate: Your shipmates. Your sales force. Your global agencies of record, Anomaly and Landor — to go beyond expectations and deliver award-winning results. This is the adventure before you.
This is a Test Company flagship brand that you will commandeer to continued global growth. Stand on the shoulders of Captain Henry Morgan, and whose legacy is still being written to this day. We’d love to meet you.

job.title: Government Compliance Analyst
job.description:
External Job Title Government Compliance Analyst
Function Finance Type of Job Full Time - Exempt Country United States External Job Description Purpose The Relay, MD distilled spirits plant pays approximately $200M per year in federal excise taxes. It is responsible for preparing and filing federal and state tax payments for spirits based beverages, in addition to filing monthly federal reports of bulk operations, warehousing and finished case good movements. This role is responsible for maintaining Relay’s compliance with the Code of Federal Regulations for distilled spirits plants. The role also reviews tax liability and drawback balance sheets and reconciles monthly with payments and drawback claims for the Relay plant as well as any necessary journal entry adjustments. The role may also reconcile drawback accounts for all North American sites (Test Company owned and 3 rd party) and file drawback claims for exported products with federal agencies in excess of $5M annually.
Decision Making The role generates bi-weekly excise tax payments and federal and state monthly reporting. The role is responsible for interpreting federal and state excise tax regulation and identifying risk pertaining to non-compliance. The person in this role also provides guidance and suggestions to the plant operation (Operations, Blending, Warehousing, and Quality) to maintain compliance with state/federal regulations. Role will help decide when to adopt changes in regulations to plant operations and give guidance and training to key personnel.
Financial Responsibility Role is responsible for paying federal excise taxes of $150M - $200M annually in bi-weekly payments, claiming Distilled Spirits tax refunds, drawbacks and Manufactured Non-beverage Product (MNBP) claims. Role files drawback claims with federal agencies in excess of $5M annually. Generates and files monthly State of Maryland returns totaling less than $1K annually.
Management Responsibility Reports to the Government Compliance Mgr. currently in IL and also works closely with on-site mgrs. in Quality, Blending, Bottling, and Warehousing operations to ensure compliance with state and federal regulations.
Complexity of Role Site expert on the Code of Federal Regulations, specifically Title 27, Part 19 and other related Parts. Regulatory compliance (state/federal) & control. Timeliness, quality and accuracy of tax payments, reports, account reconciliations, and other transactions. Leads yearly audits by the State of MD. Site lead for audits of production and shipping records and associated tax payments by Tax and Trade Bureau (TTB) every three years.
Key Outputs/Deliverables Prepare and file bi-weekly federal tax payments and monthly state tax payments on time and accurately. Generate monthly federal and state reports recording flow of liquid through plant. All reports are submitted on time, accurate and complete. Partner with operations to ensure that all transactions and processes remain compliant with federal/state regulations. Support operations and plant finance with yearly physical inventories of bulk, barrel and finished goods. Perform monthly account reconciliations on tax and drawback accounts. Partner with shipping on the export of finished case goods to maintain drawback balance of< 90 days and ensure exports have acceptable proof of export. Prepare for governmental agencies' audit and assist other sites in preparation for and during governmental agencies’ audits.
Experience and Skills Business, finance, accounting or equivalent college degree or financial or operational background / exposure to supply chain activities Some accounting experience in a manufacturing environment is helpful Knowledge of Code of Federal Regulations (Title 27) Strong SAP with MS Excel & Word. Ability to effectively both verbal/written, with internal Test Company stakeholders, external government agencies, and Test Company 3 rd Party vendors/customers. Ability to juggle priorities and work under pressure and detail oriented.
